metadata.title: Prospective Multicenter Study of Children With Bronchiolitis Requiring Mechanical Ventilatione492-e500 ABBREVIATIONS CI-confidence intervals CPAP-continuous positive airway pressure ED-emergency department HRV-human rhinovirus IQR-interquartile ranges MARC-Multicenter Airway Research Collaboration NPA-nasopharyngeal aspirate OR-odds ratio PCR-polymerase chain reaction RSV-respiratory syncytial virus

abstract.original_text: WHAT'S KNOWN ON THIS SUBJECT: Bronchiolitis is one of the most common infectious respiratory conditions of early childhood, and most children have a mild clinical course. Unfortunately, the small subgroup of children requiring continuous positive airway pressure and/or intubation remains ill-defined.

sentences.segment_text: WHAT 'S KNOWN ON THIS SUBJECT : Bronchiolitis is one of the most common infectious respiratory conditions of early childhood ,
and most children have a mild clinical course .
Unfortunately , the small subgroup of children requiring continuous positive airway pressure and/or intubation remains ill-defined .

abstract.original_text: WHAT THIS STUDY ADDS: In children with bronchiolitis, we found several demographic, historical, and clinical factors that predicted the need for mechanical respiratory support including in utero smoke exposure. We also found a novel subgroup of children with bronchiolitis who have a rapid respiratory decline. abstract OBJECTIVE: To identify factors associated with continuous positive airway pressure (CPAP) and/or intubation for children with bronchiolitis.

sentences.segment_text: WHAT THIS STUDY ADDS : In children with bronchiolitis ,
we found several demographic , historical ,
and clinical factors that predicted the need for mechanical respiratory support including in utero smoke exposure .
We also found a novel subgroup of children with bronchiolitis who have a rapid respiratory decline .
abstract OBJECTIVE : To identify factors associated with continuous positive airway pressure ( CPAP ) and/or intubation for children with bronchiolitis .

abstract.original_text: We performed a 16-center, prospective cohort study of hospitalized children aged ,2 years with bronchiolitis. For 3 consecutive years from November 1 until March 31, beginning in 2007, researchers collected clinical data and a nasopharyngeal aspirate from study participants. We oversampled children from the ICU. Samples of nasopharyngeal aspirate were tested by polymerase chain reaction for 18 pathogens.

sentences.segment_text: We performed a 16-center , prospective cohort study of hospitalized children aged ,2 years with bronchiolitis .
For 3 consecutive years from November 1 until March 31 ,
beginning in 2007 , researchers collected clinical data and a nasopharyngeal aspirate from study participants .
We oversampled children from the ICU .
Samples of nasopharyngeal aspirate were tested by polymerase chain reaction for 18 pathogens .

abstract.original_text: RESULTS: There were 161 children who required CPAP and/or intubation. The median age of the overall cohort was 4 months; 59% were male; 61% white, 24% black, and 36% Hispanic. In the multivariable model predicting CPAP/intubation, the significant factors were: age ,2 months (odds ratio [OR] 4.3; 95% confidence interval [CI] 1.7-11.5), maternal smoking during pregnancy (OR 1.4; 95% CI 1.1-1.9), birth weight ,5 pounds (OR 1.7; 95% CI 1.0-2.6), breathing difficulty began ,1 day before admission (OR 1.6; 95% CI 1.2-2.1), presence of apnea (OR 4.8; 95% CI 2.5-8.5), inadequate oral intake (OR 2.5; 95% CI 1.3-4.3), severe retractions (OR 11.1; 95% CI 2.4-33.0), and room air oxygen saturation ,85% (OR 3.3; 95% CI 2.0-4.8). The optimism-corrected c-statistic for the final model was 0.80.

sentences.segment_text: RESULTS : There were 161 children who required CPAP and/or intubation .
The median age of the overall cohort was 4 months ; 59 % were male ; 61 % white ,
24 % black , and 36 % Hispanic .
In the multivariable model predicting CPAP/intubation ,
the significant factors were : age ,2 months ( odds ratio ( OR ) 4.3 ; 95 % confidence interval ( CI ) 1.7-11.5 ) ,
maternal smoking during pregnancy ( OR 1.4 ; 95 % CI 1.1-1.9 ) ,
birth weight ,5 pounds ( OR 1.7 ; 95 % CI 1.0-2.6 ) ,
breathing difficulty began ,1 day before admission ( OR 1.6 ; 95 % CI 1.2-2.1 ) ,
presence of apnea ( OR 4.8 ; 95 % CI 2.5-8.5 ) ,
inadequate oral intake ( OR 2.5 ; 95 % CI 1.3-4.3 ) ,
severe retractions ( OR 11.1 ; 95 % CI 2.4-33.0 ) ,
and room air oxygen saturation ,85 % ( OR 3.3 ; 95 % CI 2.0-4.8 ) .
The optimism-corrected c-statistic for the final model was 0.80 .

abstract.original_text: In this multicenter study of children hospitalized with bronchiolitis, we identified several demographic, historical, and clinical factors that predicted the use of CPAP and/or intubation, including children born to mothers who smoked during pregnancy. We also identified a novel subgroup of children who required mechanical respiratory support ,1 day after respiratory symptoms began.

sentences.segment_text: In this multicenter study of children hospitalized with bronchiolitis ,
we identified several demographic , historical ,
and clinical factors that predicted the use of CPAP and/or intubation ,
including children born to mothers who smoked during pregnancy .
We also identified a novel subgroup of children who required mechanical respiratory support ,1 day after respiratory symptoms began .
